meanings.definition: Get rid of as no longer useful or desirable.
meanings.sent1: I will discard this broken toy.
meanings.sent2: Please discard the empty box in the recycling bin.
meanings.sent3: He decided to discard his old habits like throwing away old clothes.
meanings.sent4: She discarded her doubts like tossing out old newspapers.
meanings.sent5: The decision to discard the plan was like throwing away a burden.

meanings.sent1: After the party, we will discard the used paper plates.
meanings.sent2: It is important to discard expired food from the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The magician will discard the playing cards like they are no longer needed.
meanings.sent4: She discarded her worries like tossing out unwanted gifts.
meanings.sent5: The idea to discard the project was like throwing away a failed experiment.
